docs.title: TrustMark Glossary
docs.text: All Term Acronym Metric  For any edits or additions to this TrustMark Glossary, please contact Pete Hitchen.

docs.title: TrustMark Glossary
docs.text:
This glossary content is maintained in this file. To update it, edit the table rows below (or regenerate them from your spreadsheet).

Name Definition Type Domain Metric Calculation Source Document [Find & Fix] Remediation Status (by Current Status) Represents the current stage of remediation actions raised after audits:Resolved: The remediation issue has been fully addressed and closed.Needs Evidence: The installer or responsible party must provide evidence that the remediation has been completed.Has Evidence: Evidence of remediation has been provided but is pending review or confirmation.No Access: Remediation could not be completed because access to the property was not possible.Overdue: The remediation deadline has passed without completion or sufficient evidence.Escalated to Scheme Provider: The remediation issue has been escalated to the relevant scheme provider for further action due to non-resolution or severity. Term Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] % of Booked Audits Completed The percentage of booked audits that have been successfully completed with an onsite audit.Purpose: Measures the lag between booking and completion, showing how many scheduled audits have been fulfilled. Metric Assurance (Number of completed onsite audits ÷ Number of booked audits) × 100 Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] % of In-Scope Properties Contacted The percentage of in-scope properties that have been contacted by TrustMark to offer an audit. Metric Assurance (Distinct contacted properties ÷ Total in-scope properties) × 100 Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Audits Booked The number of in-scope properties where the household has confirmed and scheduled an onsite audit with TrustMark. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Average Days to Resolved The average number of days taken to resolve a remediation case, calculated from the date the remediation was raised to the date it was marked as resolved.Purpose: Measures the efficiency of the remediation process and helps identify delays in closing compliance issues. Metric Assurance Average of (Resolved Date – Raised Date) across all resolved remediations Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Call Back The number of in-scope properties where the household requested or required a follow-up call to arrange an audit. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] CAT1 EWI Non-Compliance Rate (%) The percentage of completed audits where the EWI measure was found to have a Category 1 (CAT1) non-compliance issue.Purpose: Focuses on the most severe compliance failures for EWI installations. Metric Assurance (Number of completed audits with CAT1 EWI non-compliance ÷ Total completed audits) × 100 Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Complete Offer of Audit A household is considered to have received a complete offer of audit if either:The household has been contacted at least 3 times, and one attempt was via email OR,The household has accepted an audit. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Declined Audit The number of in-scope properties where the household refused the offer of an onsite audit. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Do Not Contact Again The number of in-scope properties where the household explicitly requested no further contact regarding audits. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] EWI Non-Compliance Rate (%) The percentage of completed audits where the EWI measure was found to be non-compliant.Purpose: Highlights the quality and compliance performance of EWI installations after audits. Metric Assurance (Number of completed audits with EWI non-compliance ÷ Total completed audits) × 100 Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Households Contacted The distinct count of in-scope properties that have been contacted by TrustMark to offer an onsite audit. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Incorrect Contact Details The number of in-scope properties where the provided contact information was invalid or inaccurate, preventing successful contact. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] In-Scope Projects Projects that meet all of the following criteria: Belong to ECO4 or GBIS schemes.Include an External Wall Insulation (EWI) measure.Have no previous onsite audit recorded. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Open Remediations The count of active remediation cases that are currently unresolved and remain open by UMR.Purpose: Tracks the volume of ongoing remediation work, helping monitor progress and outstanding compliance actions. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Open Remediations Overdue The count of active remediation cases that are still open and have exceeded their allowed timeframe for resolution:CAT1 Issues: Overdue if not remediated within 24 hours of being raised.Major and Minor Issues: Overdue if not remediated within 8 weeks of being raised.Purpose: Highlights remediation cases that are past their deadline, helping prioritise urgent follow-up actions. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Open Remediations Overdue % The percentage of raised remediations that are currently open and overdue.Purpose: Shows the proportion of remediation cases that are overdue compared to all raised cases, helping monitor compliance and escalation risk. Metric Assurance (Open overdue remediations ÷ Total raised remediations) × 100 Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Overall Audit Outcome (by Outcome) Represents the classification of completed audits based on their final result:PASS Audits: All EWI measures fully compliantCAT1 Audits: At least one Category 1 (critical) non-compliance identifiedMajor Audits: Major non-compliance issues found (but not CAT1 level)Minor Audits: Only minor non-compliance issues identifiedNot Determined Audits: Compliance outcome could not be determined (e.g., incomplete data or inconclusive inspection) Term Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Remediation Raised The count of audits completed where a remediation report has been raised due to identified non-compliance or issues requiring corrective action.Purpose: Tracks how many audits result in formal remediation, highlighting areas needing follow-up and quality improvement. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Remediation Status (Overdue or Within Target) Indicates whether a remediation is within the allowed timeframe or overdue, based on severity:CAT1 Issues: Must be remediated within 24 hours of being raised.Major and Minor Issues: Must be remediated within 8 weeks of being raised.If the remediation exceeds these timeframes, it is classified as Overdue; otherwise, it is Within Target.Purpose: Helps monitor compliance with remediation deadlines and identify delays in corrective actions. Term Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Remediations Resolved in Time % The percentage of remediations resolved within the allowed timeframe, based on severity:CAT1 Issues: Resolved within 1 day (24 hours) of being raised.Major and Minor Issues: Resolved within 8 weeks of being raised.Purpose: Measures compliance with remediation deadlines and highlights process efficiency. Metric Assurance (Number of remediations resolved within target ÷ Total resolved remediations) × 100 Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Remediations Resolved Not Within Time %  The percentage of remediations resolved outside the allowed timeframe, based on severity:CAT1 Issues: Took longer than 1 day (24 hours) to resolve.Major and Minor Issues: Took longer than 8 weeks to resolve.Purpose: Highlights delays in remediation processes. Metric Assurance (Number of remediations resolved outside target ÷ Total resolved remediations) × 100 Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Sum of EWI Audit Measures Non-Compliance by Outcome The total sum of non-compliances for a measure, grouped by audit outcome category (CAT1, Major, Minor).Purpose: Helps identify the severity and distribution of non-compliance across different audit outcomes. Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard [Find & Fix] Total Contact Attempts The count of all attempts made by TrustMark to offer an onsite audit to in-scope properties. Includes every call or communication attempt, regardless of outcome (e.g., No Answer, Call Back, Declined Audit). Metric Assurance Find & Fix - EWI Performance Indicators dashboard ADF Approved Document F – part of UK Building Regulations relating to ventilation. Acronym Cross-Domain Connected For Warmth TMK Licence Plus V3.pdf ASHP ASHP  Air Source Heat Pump Acronym Cross-Domain ATP Able To Pay – IAA scheme for non-subsidised consumers, referenced as model for Licence Plus. Acronym Cross-Domain Connected For Warmth TMK Licence Plus V3.pdf @@ -129,6 +153,7 @@ Non‑conformance Failure to meet the requirements of PAS 2030, manufacturer’s instructions, or statutory regulations. Term Cross-Domain PAS2030_2023.pdf Non‑conformance Rate Percentage of installations found to have defects or deviations from PAS 2030 requirements. Metric Cross-Domain Calculated as (number of non‑conformances ÷ total installations) × 100. PAS2030_2023.pdf NSAI National Standards Authority of Ireland – certification body for products and processes. Acronym Cross-Domain Connected For Warmth TMK Licence Plus V3.pdf OCR Optical Character Recognition Acronym Assurance OFGEM OFGEM  Office of Gas and Electricity Markets Operational Threat Intelligence Real-time intelligence about attack techniques, indicators, and alerts to anticipate and mitigate threats. Term Cross-Domain 1 ISMS.POL.013 Threat & Vulnerability Intelligence Management Policy V1.0.pdf Operative Person employed by Main Contractor/Installer to undertake EEM installation tasks. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf @@ -150,7 +175,7 @@ RDSAP Reduced Data Standard Assessment Procedure – a simplified method for energy performance assessment in existing dwellings. Acronym Cross-Domain Connected For Warmth TMK Licence Plus V3.pdf Record Keeping The process of maintaining accurate records of installations, inspections, tests, and handovers for compliance and audit. Term Cross-Domain PAS2030_2023.pdf Record Retention Policy defining how long departmental records must be maintained, reviewed, and securely disposed of. Term Cross-Domain 1 ISMS.POL.012 Record Retention Policy & Schedule V1.pdf Record Retention Period Predefined duration each record type is maintained before disposal. Metric Cross-Domain Defined per ISMS.REG.007 schedule. 1 ISMS.POL.012 Record Retention Policy & Schedule V1.pdf Record Retention Period Predefined duration each record type is maintained before disposal. Term Cross-Domain Defined per ISMS.REG.007 schedule. 1 ISMS.POL.012 Record Retention Policy & Schedule V1.pdf Register of Regulated Qualifications Register of nationally accredited qualifications (maintained by Ofqual and equivalents in devolved nations). Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf Remediation The process of addressing non-compliance issues within the Retrofit Portal by reviewing evidence uploaded by the Retrofit Coordinator. Term Cross-Domain DT Remediation and extending dates V1.0 1.pdf Retrofit Advice Advice given to clients/householders on retrofit options, design, operation, and maintenance for efficiency. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf @@ -173,31 +198,32 @@ SMS Short Messaging Service – channel for emergency staff communication. Acronym Cross-Domain TM.BCP.001 Business Continuity Plan V2.0.pdf SMT Senior Management Team – executive team responsible for oversight and BCP activation. Acronym Cross-Domain TM.BCP.001 Business Continuity Plan V2.0.pdf Snowflake Cloud-based data warehouse and analytics platform used for MI/BI reporting. Term Cross-Domain TrustMark - IT Disaster Recovery Guide - v1.6.pdf SSoT Single Source of Truth Acronym Cross-Domain Stage-by-stage Retrofit process where whole-dwelling plan is implemented in phases rather than at once. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf Strategic Threat Intelligence Reports on evolving threat landscape, attacker types, and high-level risks to inform long-term decisions. Term Cross-Domain 1 ISMS.POL.013 Threat & Vulnerability Intelligence Management Policy V1.0.pdf Surveillance Rate Monitoring proportion applied when guarantees are issued. Term Cross-Domain 10% of cases, split as 30% pre, 15% mid, 35% post, 20% floating. Connected For Warmth TMK Licence Plus V3.pdf System Context Diagram Visual representation of TrustMark systems and providers, showing integrations and data flows. Term Cross-Domain TrustMark - IT Disaster Recovery Guide - v1.6.pdf System-built Dwelling Building with frame/prefabricated panels (timber/steel/concrete) or timber-frame with brick/stone cladding. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf Tactical Threat Intelligence Information on attacker tools, technologies, and methodologies for planning defences. Term Cross-Domain 1 ISMS.POL.013 Threat & Vulnerability Intelligence Management Policy V1.0.pdf Tech Influence Supplier hosting and running the Data Warehouse and Retrofit Portal, with integrations for Stripe and Ofgem APIs. Hosted in AWS. Term Cross-Domain TrustMark - IT Disaster Recovery Guide - v1.6.pdf Testing Activities that confirm correct installation and performance of an EEM, e.g. airtightness or system checks. Term Cross-Domain PAS2030_2023.pdf Thermal Bridge Part of building envelope with higher heat transfer (due to geometry or material) causing local heat loss. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf Thermal By-pass Unintended air movement on warm side of insulation, reducing effectiveness. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf Threat Intelligence Collection and analysis of threat data (strategic, tactical, operational) to prevent attacks and reduce risks. Term Cross-Domain 1 ISMS.POL.013 Threat & Vulnerability Intelligence Management Policy V1.0.pdf Threat Intelligence Assessment Evaluation of threat intel sources using attributes: Relevance, Insightful, Contextual, Actionable. Term Cross-Domain Template-based assessment including source, timing, context, and required actions. 1 ISMS.POL.013 Threat & Vulnerability Intelligence Management Policy V1.0.pdf TM TrustMark – UK Government Endorsed Quality scheme for tradespeople. Acronym Cross-Domain Connected For Warmth TMK Licence Plus V3.pdf TMLN TrustMark Licence Number – a unique identifier issued to registered TrustMark Licence Holders. Acronym Cross-Domain TrustMark Business Glossary Update Toolbox Talk Meeting between Retrofit Coordinator, Main Contractor/Installer and operatives to explain design intent. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf Traditional Construction Buildings pre‑1919 with solid/moisture-permeable walls or timber-frame with infill. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf Triggering Event Event that initiates BCP activation, such as IT failure, natural disaster, cyber incident, pandemic, supply chain disruption, or regulatory change. Term Cross-Domain TM.BCP.001 Business Continuity Plan V2.0.pdf UAT User Access Testing Acronym Cross-Domain UFI UFI  Under Floor Installation UKAS UKAS  UK’s National Accreditation Body UMR Unique Measure Reference Acronym Cross-Domain Unity Cloud Supplier responsible for IT services including Microsoft products, VPN, internet, domain registration. Term Cross-Domain TrustMark - IT Disaster Recovery Guide - v1.6.pdf Unread Messages Notifications in the Retrofit Portal dashboard that require user attention and closure once reviewed. Term Cross-Domain DT Remediation and extending dates V1.0 1.pdf UPRN Unique Property Reference Number – a unique identifier assigned to every addressable location in Great Britain. (Source: Ordnance Survey) Acronym Cross-Domain TrustMark Business Glossary Update Ventilation Assessment Assessment of adequacy of an existing ventilation system prior to retrofit. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf Ventilation Upgrade Improvement or replacement of existing ventilation system as part of retrofit. Term Cross-Domain PAS2035_2023.pdf Williams Lea (TSO) Supplier supporting the HSE App development and maintenance. Term Cross-Domain TrustMark - IT Disaster Recovery Guide - v1.6.pdf XML Extensible Markup Language file – format for data exchange and lodgement submission. Acronym Cross-Domain Connected For Warmth TMK Licence Plus V3.pdf
